process.name: QAFileUtil
process.narrative: File utility actions for use in the QA tests

stage.name: Stage1
stage.code:
Public Function GetDataTable(ByVal ColumnNamesCSV As String, ByVal ColumnTypesCSV As String) As DataTable
Dim objTable As DataTable Dim objColumn As DataColumn Dim aColumnNames As String() = ColumnNamesCSV.Split(",") Dim aColumnTypes As String() = ColumnTypesCSV.Split(",")
Try objTable = New DataTable For i As Integer = 0 To aColumnNames.Length - 1 objColumn = New DataColumn objColumn.DataType = System.Type.GetType(aColumnTypes(i).Trim) objColumn.ColumnName = aColumnNames(i).Trim objTable.Columns.Add(objColumn) Next
Catch e As Exception objTable = nothing End Try
Return objTable
End Function

stage.name: new
stage.narrative:
Initialise Page
This is an optional page where you might choose to perform some initialisation tasks after your business object is loaded.
The initialise action will be called automatically immediately after loading your business object.
You will not be able to call this action from a business process, nor will it be called at any other time than after the creation of the object.

stage.name: Get Files
stage.narrative:
Gets all files in the specified folder matching the supplied file type pattern string.
Patterns - A comma-separated list of file patterns identifying the type(s) of files sought. Eg "*.jpg, *.png" retrieves all jpg and png files. The pattern "*.*" will return all files. It does not matter whether you leave a space between each pattern, or not.

condition.narrative: All matching files will be returned.

stage.name: Get Files
stage.code:
Dim objTable As DataTable Dim objRow As DataRow Dim aFiles As FileInfo() Dim aPatterns As String() Dim oDirectory As New DirectoryInfo(Folder)
Try
'Create a data table to output as a collection objTable = GetDataTable( _ "Path," _ & "Folder," _ & "Name," _ & "Extension," _ & "Created," _ & "Last Accessed," _ & "Last Written," _ & "Read Only," _ & "Bytes", _ "System.String," _ & "System.String," _ & "System.String," _ & "System.String," _ & "System.DateTime," _ & "System.DateTime," _ & "System.DateTime," _ & "System.Boolean," _ & "System.Double")
aPatterns = Patterns_CSV.split(",")
For each sPattern As String in aPatterns aFiles = oDirectory.GetFiles(sPattern.Trim) For each oFile as FileInfo in aFiles objRow = objTable.NewRow() objRow("Path") = oFile.FullName objRow("Folder") = oFile.DirectoryName objRow("Name") = oFile.Name objRow("Extension") = oFile.Extension objRow("Created") = oFile.CreationTime objRow("Last Accessed") = oFile.LastAccessTime objRow("Last Written") = oFile.LastWriteTime objRow("Read Only") = oFile.IsReadOnly objRow("Bytes") = oFile.Length
objTable.Rows.Add(objRow) Next Next
Files = objTable Success = True Message = "" Catch e As Exception Success = False Message = e.Message End Try

stage.name: Delete Files
stage.narrative: Deletes all files in the specified folder, matching the supplied file extension pattern.

condition.narrative: The named folder must exist.
All files within the named folder which match the supplied pattern will have been deleted.

stage.name: Delete Files
stage.code:
Dim aFiles As String()= _ Directory.GetFiles(Folder, Pattern)
For each f as String in aFiles File.Delete(f) Next

stage.name: Append to Text File
stage.narrative: Appends some text to the specified file.

condition.narrative: There must be sufficient disk space to accommodate the new data. The destination file need not exist already. If it does not exist then it will be created.
The supplied text will have been appended.

stage.name: Append
stage.code:
Try
Dim sw As StreamWriter
If File.Exists(File_Name) = False Then sw = File.CreateText(File_Name) Else sw = File.AppendText(File_Name) End If
sw.WriteLine(Text) sw.Flush() sw.Close()
Success = True Message = "" Catch e As Exception Success = False Message = e.Message End Try

stage.name: Read Text
stage.code: Try If File.Exists(File_Name) Then Dim sr As New StreamReader(File_Name) Text = sr.ReadToEnd sr.Close() Success = True Message = "" Else Throw New ApplicationException("The file at " & File_Name & " does not exist") End If Catch e As Exception Success = False Message = e.Message End Try

stage.name: Write Text File
stage.narrative: Writes text to a file. Any existing text in the file (if it exists) will be replaced.

condition.narrative: There must be sufficient disk space to accommodate the new data.
The supplied text will have been written to the destination file.

stage.name: Write
stage.code: Try File.WriteAllText(File_Name, Text) Success = True Message = "" Catch e As Exception Success = False Message = e.Message End Try

stage.name: File Exists
stage.narrative: Determines whether the specified file exsts. The full path must be specified.

condition.narrative: The existence of the file of interest will have been determined.

stage.name: File Exists
stage.code:
Try
Exists = File.Exists(File_Name)
Catch e As Exception Exists = False End Try

stage.name: new
stage.narrative:
Clean Up Page
This is an optional page where you might choose to perform some finalisation (or "cleanup") tasks as your business object is closed down.
The cleanup action will be called automatically immediately after closing your business object at the end of a business process.
You will not be able to call this action from a business process, nor will it be called at any other time than before the disposal of the business object.

stage.name: Copy File
stage.narrative: Copies a file to the named destination.

condition.narrative: The file to be copied must exist. The full destination path must be specified. There must be sufficient free disk space to complete the operation.
The file will have been copied to the specified destination.

stage.name: Copy
stage.code:
Try
Dim sSourceFolder As String = Mid(File_Path, 1, File_Path.LastIndexOf("\") + 1) Dim sSourceFileName As String = Mid(File_Path, File_Path.LastIndexOf("\") + 2)
Dim sDestinationFolder As String Dim sDestinationFile As String If Directory.Exists(Destination) Then sDestinationFolder = Destination If Not sDestinationFolder.EndsWith("\") Then sDestinationFolder &= "\" End If sDestinationFile = "" Else sDestinationFolder = "" sDestinationFile = Destination End If
Dim objDirectoryInfo As DirectoryInfo = New DirectoryInfo(sSourceFolder) Dim aFiles As FileInfo() = objDirectoryInfo.GetFiles(sSourceFileName)
For Each oFile As FileInfo In aFiles If sDestinationFolder = "" Then oFile.CopyTo(sDestinationFile, True) Else oFile.CopyTo(sDestinationFolder & oFile.Name, True) End If Next
Success = True Message = "" Catch e As Exception Success = False Message = e.Message End Try

stage.name: Get File Size
stage.narrative: Gets the size of the specified file.

condition.narrative: The specified file must exist.
The file size will have been determined.

stage.name: Get Byte Count
stage.code: Try Dim fi As New FileInfo(File_Path) Bytes = fi.Length Catch Bytes = 0 End Try

stage.name: Delete File
stage.narrative: Deletes a single file from the file system.

condition.narrative: The file to be deleted must exist.
The named file will have been deleted.

stage.name: Delete File
stage.code: File.Delete(File_Name)

stage.name: Get Folders
stage.narrative: Gets a collection of all subfolders in the specified file system folder.

condition.narrative: The named folder must exist.
All sub-folders will be returned, if any exist.

stage.name: Get Folders
stage.code:
Dim objTable As DataTable Dim objRow As DataRow Dim aFolders As DirectoryInfo() Dim oDirectory As New DirectoryInfo(Folder)
Try
'Create a data table to output as a collection objTable = GetDataTable( _ "Path," _ & "Name," _ & "Created," _ & "Last Accessed," _ & "Last Written", _ "System.String," _ & "System.String," _ & "System.String," _ & "System.DateTime," _ & "System.DateTime")
aFolders = oDirectory.GetDirectories() For each oFolder as DirectoryInfo in aFolders objRow = objTable.NewRow() objRow("Path") = oFolder.FullName objRow("Name") = oFolder.Name objRow("Created") = oFolder.CreationTime objRow("Last Accessed") = oFolder.LastAccessTime objRow("Last Written") = oFolder.LastWriteTime
objTable.Rows.Add(objRow) Next
Folders = objTable Success = True Message = "" Catch e As Exception Success = False Message = e.Message End Try

stage.name: Move File
stage.narrative: Moves the specified file to a new location.

condition.narrative: The file to be moved must exist. There must be sufficient disk space to move the file.

stage.name: Move
stage.code:
Try
Dim sSourceFolder As String = Mid(File_Path, 1, File_Path.LastIndexOf("\") + 1) Dim sSourceFileName As String = Mid(File_Path, File_Path.LastIndexOf("\") + 2)
Dim sDestinationFolder As String Dim sDestinationFile As String If Directory.Exists(Destination) Then sDestinationFolder = Destination If Not sDestinationFolder.EndsWith("\") Then sDestinationFolder &= "\" End If sDestinationFile = "" Else sDestinationFolder = "" sDestinationFile = Destination End If
Dim objDirectoryInfo As DirectoryInfo = New DirectoryInfo(sSourceFolder) Dim aFiles As FileInfo() = objDirectoryInfo.GetFiles(sSourceFileName)
For Each oFile As FileInfo In aFiles If sDestinationFolder = "" Then oFile.MoveTo(sDestinationFile) Else oFile.MoveTo(sDestinationFolder & oFile.Name) End If Next
Success = True Message = "" Catch e As Exception Success = False Message = e.Message End Try

stage.name: Split Path
stage.narrative: Splits a file path into its component parts - the filename and the folder path. The trailing backslash is omitted from the directory part.

condition.narrative: The specified path must correspond to a file which exists on disk.
The path will have been separated.

stage.name: Split Path
stage.code: Folder = Path.GetDirectoryName(File_Path) File_Name = Path.GetFileName(File_Path)

stage.name: Directory Exists
stage.code:
Try
Exists = Directory.Exists(Directory_Name)
Catch e As Exception Exists = False End Try

stage.name: Write Binary Data
stage.code: Try File.WriteAllBytes(FileName, Binary_Data) Success = True Message = "" Catch e As Exception Success = False Message = e.Message End Try

condition.narrative: The specified path must correspond to a file which exists on disk.
The path will have been separated.

stage.name: Combine Path
stage.code: Path = IO.Path.Combine(Folder, File_Name)

stage.name: Create Directory
stage.code:
Try If Not Directory.Exists(Directory_Path) Then Directory.CreateDirectory(Directory_Path) Else If ErrorIfAlreadyExists Then Throw New ApplicationException("Directory already exists") End If
Success = True Catch Ex as Exception Success = False Error_Message = Ex.ToString() End Try

stage.name: Delete Directory
stage.narrative: Deletes a directory and if Recursive is True will delete all subdirectories if present

stage.name: Delete Directory
stage.code:
Try If Directory.Exists(Directory_Path) Then
Dim SubDirectories As Boolean SubDirectories = False
Dim SubdirectoryEntries As String() SubdirectoryEntries = Directory.GetDirectories(Directory_Path)
If SubdirectoryEntries.Length > 0 Then SubDirectories = True
If SubDirectories And Not Recursive Then Throw New ApplicationException("Directory has sub directories and will not be deleted")
Directory.Delete(Directory_Path, Recursive)
Else If ErrorIfNotExists Then Throw New ApplicationException("Directory does not exist") End If
Success = True
Catch UAEx as UnauthorizedAccessException Success = False Error_Message = "The caller does not have the required permission to delete this directory or sub directories"
Catch ANEx as ArgumentNullException Success = False Error_Message = "Please check Directory Path parameter is not null"
Catch AEx as ArgumentException Success = False Error_Message = "Please check Directory Path parameter is a valid string"
Catch PTLEx as PathTooLongException Success = False Error_Message = "The specified path, file name, or both exceed the system-defined maximum length. For example, on Windows-based platforms, paths must be less than 248 characters and file names must be less than 260 characters."
Catch Ex as Exception Success = False Error_Message = Ex.ToString()
End Try

stage.name: Sub Directory Exists
stage.narrative: Checks if a directory contains sub directories

stage.name: Get Sub Directories
stage.code:
Try
Exists = False If Directory.Exists(Directory_Path) Then Dim subdirectoryEntries As String()
subdirectoryEntries = Directory.GetDirectories(Directory_Path)
If subdirectoryEntries.Length > 0 Then Exists = True
Else Throw New ApplicationException("Directory does not exist") End If
Success = True Catch Ex as Exception Success = False Error_Message = Ex.ToString() End Try

stage.name: Parse CSV
stage.code:
Dim HDRString As String = "No" If First_Line_Is_Header Then HDRSTring = "Yes"
Dim Folder as String = nothing Dim FileName As String = Nothing Split_Path(CSV_Location, Folder, Filename)
Dim cn As New OleDbConnection("Provider=Microsoft.Jet.OLEDB.4.0; Data Source=" & Folder & ";Extended Properties=""Text;HDR=" & HDRString & ";FMT=Delimited""") Dim da As New OleDbDataAdapter() Dim ds As New DataSet() Dim cd As New OleDbCommand("SELECT * FROM [" & Filename & "]", cn)
cn.Open() da.SelectCommand = cd ds.Clear() da.Fill(ds, "CSV") Values = ds.Tables(0) cn.Close()

stage.name: Get Special Folder Path
stage.narrative: Gets the path of a special folder.

input.name: Special Folder Name
input.narrative: The name of the special folder. Supported values include ApplicationData, DesktopDirectory, MyDocuments, ProgramFiles. The values correspond to the .NET System.Environment.SpecialFolder enumeration.

output.name: Folder Path
output.narrative: The corresponding path of the requested special folder

stage.name: Get Folder Path
stage.code:
Dim EnumVal as System.Environment.SpecialFolder Try EnumVal = Ctype(System.Enum.Parse(GetType(System.Environment.SpecialFolder), Special_Folder), System.Environment.SpecialFolder) Catch Ex As Exception Throw New ApplicationException("Value '" & Special_Folder & "' is not recognised as a special folder") End Try
Folder_Path = System.Environment.GetFolderPath(EnumVal)

stage.name: Read Head of File
stage.narrative: Reads the beginning of the specified file - the required number of lines, or the required number of characters, whichever value is provided.

stage.name: Head(File, Characters, Lines)
stage.code:
Using sr As New StreamReader(filename) If charCount > 0 AndAlso lineCount = 0 Then Dim chars(charCount-1) as Char Dim readCount as Integer = 0 While readCount < chars.Length AndAlso Not sr.EndOfStream readCount += sr.ReadBlock(chars, readCount, chars.Length - readCount) End While outputTxt = New String(chars)
ElseIf lineCount > 0 AndAlso charCount = 0 Then Dim sb as New StringBuilder() For i as Integer = 0 To lineCount - 1 Dim line as String = sr.ReadLine() ' Null == EndOfStream If line Is Nothing Then Exit For sb.Append(line).Append(vbCrLf) Next outputTxt = sb.ToString()
Else Throw New Exception( _ "Invalid char / line config : " & _ charCount & " chars and " & lineCount & " lines") End If End Using

input.name: File Name
input.narrative: The file from which the head should be read

input.name: Lines
input.narrative: The lines to read from the head of the file - Either this or 'Characters' should be set, but not both

input.name: Characters
input.narrative: The characters to read from the head of the file - Either this or 'Lines' should be set, but not both
